comments:
hi,

do you have an idea
how the following may happen?

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2005-06-05 17:56:38.63
!MESSAGE java.lang.StackOverflowError
!STACK 0
java.lang.StackOverflowError
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.CallWindowProc(OS.java:1574)

(AbstractTreeViewer.java:1073)

(AbstractTreeViewer.java:1073)

(AbstractTreeViewer.java:1073)

(AbstractTreeViewer.java:1073)
...

and so on

Is your tree very deep?  You will need to provide some code that shows the 
problem.
the tree is very flat. i just remove a node in the content provider.

it's a single call of
org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.refresh()
that causes this stack overflow.
any ideas?

Hi Jan!  I don't have any ideas.  Without some sample code, I can't do much.  
For example, the bug could be in SWT, JFace TreeViewer or in your application 
code.

Adding Tod for his thoughts.

Do you have the same Object twice in the tree? You can potentially create this
if the child of an element an an element are the same

i have checked it. i don't have such duplicate objects.

this is my content provider:
http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/*checkout*/dome/dome/src/org/omwg/ui/mode
ls/MappingDocumentModel.java

this is my viewer:
http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/*checkout*/dome/dome/src/org/omwg/ui/view
s/TreeView.java
Tod, can you take a look at this and invoke me as necessary?

Can you give us a little more than this - like a little app that uses this
content provider?

it doesn't run at the moment.

this is the respective part class:
http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/*checkout*/dome/dome/src/org/omwg/ui/part
s/MappingDocumentPart.java

you can download the program from
http://dome.sourceforge.net/installer/install.htm

after installing:

 - create a new .wsml file and create a new ontology in it
 - create a second .wsml file with another ontology
 - create a new .map file for ontology mappings
 - while holding down the control key drag a concept from one ontology onto a 
concept of the other ontology
 - this adds a mapping in the mapping editor
 - if you now right click on the mapping and select "delete" the stack 
overflow happens

wow - it seems to be fixed in the latest eclipse version (Version: 3.1.0
Build id: I20050627-1435)
Thanks Jan. I'll mark it WORKSFORME and feel free to reopen if it happens again
